metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3500 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in djvulibre-3.5.28 and earlier. A Stack overflow in function DJVU::DjVuDocument::get_djvu_file() via crafted djvu file may lead to application crash and other consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

djview - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
djview3 - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
djvulibre-bin - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
djvulibre-desktop - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
djvuserve - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
libdjvulibre-text - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
libdjvulibre21 - 3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: djvulibre package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27.1-8ubuntu0.3').
